com.aevi.systembar

Class SystemBarService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aevi.systembar.SystemBarService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AeviService

    public class SystemBarService
extends java.lang.Object
implements AeviService
    The SystemBarService provides control over the android system bar. use the methods setHomeButtonVisibility, setBackButtonVisibility and setRecentAppsButtonVisibility to manipulate the visibility of the various buttons.

    Please see the SystemBarServiceProvider on how to initialize this service.

      • setHomeButtonVisibility

        public void setHomeButtonVisibility(boolean visible)
        Show or hide the home button in the system bar
        Parameters:

      • createIntent

        public static android.content.Intent createIntent()
        Creates an Intent that can be used to bind the crash log service.
        Returns:

      • disableRestore

        public static android.os.Bundle disableRestore(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Helper method to prevent the Navigation Buttons from briefly appearing during the transition time when a second Activity is started.

        Typical usage: 

         protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
     savedInstanceState = SystemBarService.disableRestore(savedInstanceState);
     super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
        ...
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - The Bundle which is passed as a parameter to the onCreate() method of an Activity. If it is null a new Bundle is created; otherwise the old one is used and all information it contains are maintained.
        Returns:
        A modified or new savedInstanceState. You should call super.onCreate(Bundle) with this returned value.
